  • 1.II.22F

    #Linear Analysis
    2005

    Let KKK be a compact Hausdorff space, and let C(K)C(K)C(K) denote the Banach space of continuous, complex-valued functions on KKK, with the supremum norm. Define what it means for a set S⊂C(K)S \subset C(K)S⊂C(K) to be totally bounded, uniformly bounded, and equicontinuous.

    Show that SSS is totally bounded if and only if it is both uniformly bounded and equicontinuous.

    Give, with justification, an example of a Banach space XXX and a subset S⊂XS \subset XS⊂X such that SSS is bounded but not totally bounded.

    #Linear Analysis

    State and prove the principle of uniform boundedness.

    [You may assume the Baire category theorem.]

    Suppose that X,YX, YX,Y and ZZZ are Banach spaces. Suppose that

    F:X×Y→ZF: X \times Y \rightarrow Z F:X×Y→Z

    is linear and continuous in each variable separately, that is to say that, if yyy is fixed,

    F(⋅,y):X→ZF(\cdot, y): X \rightarrow Z F(⋅,y):X→Z

    is a continuous linear map and, if xxx is fixed,

    F(x,⋅):Y→ZF(x, \cdot): Y \rightarrow Z F(x,⋅):Y→Z

    is a continuous linear map. Show that there exists an MMM such that

    ∥F(x,y)∥Z⩽M∥x∥X∥y∥Y\|F(x, y)\|_{Z} \leqslant M\|x\|_{X}\|y\|_{Y} ∥F(x,y)∥Z​⩽M∥x∥X​∥y∥Y​

    for all x∈X,y∈Yx \in X, y \in Yx∈X,y∈Y. Deduce that FFF is continuous.

    Suppose X,Y,ZX, Y, ZX,Y,Z and WWW are Banach spaces. Suppose that

    G:X×Y×W→ZG: X \times Y \times W \rightarrow Z G:X×Y×W→Z

    is linear and continuous in each variable separately. Does it follow that GGG is continuous? Give reasons.

    Suppose that X,YX, YX,Y and ZZZ are Banach spaces. Suppose that

    H:X×Y→ZH: X \times Y \rightarrow Z H:X×Y→Z

    is continuous in each variable separately. Does it follow that HHH is continuous? Give reasons.

    #Linear Analysis
    2010

    For a sequence x=(x1,x2,…)x=\left(x_{1}, x_{2}, \ldots\right)x=(x1​,x2​,…) with xj∈Cx_{j} \in \mathbb{C}xj​∈C for all j⩾1j \geqslant 1j⩾1, let
